title: Introducing: INHEAVEN
content:
Having already drawn comparisons to the likes of Sonic Youth and The Jesus and Mary Chain, London’s INHEAVEN have made a very strong impact in a very short space of time.

Emerging with the undeniably anthemic  ‘Regeneration’, the band had unleashed a call-to-arms to their peers and a wider youth culture, imploring the importance of the now as an answer to a pervading sense of angst. While ‘Regeneration’ may have been a raucous cry to the world, the band’s sophomore track ‘Slow’ presents itself as a muddier, darker affair, as it is sunk in off kilter guitar riffs and warbling vocals. In presenting ‘Slow’ INHEAVEN demonstrated a more intimate, vulnerable dimension to themselves and their sound, and combined with ‘Regeneration’ it only makes us that much eager to hear their next release.

Follow our Spotify On Repeat playlist for a selection of the current hottest tracks.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d0e
